intro: Platanthera pachyglossa, commonly known as the long-lipped twayblade, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a perennial herb with a slender, leafless stem that bears a single, showy flower. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, elongated lip that is often tinged with purple or yellow. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and bogs. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
